subject: Investing
title: How the Fed Moves Bond Markets
description: A short lesson to help you apply How the Fed Moves Bond Markets.

hook.text: The Federal Reserve raises rates by 0.25%. Within minutes, trillions of dollars in bond values shift.

buildup.text: The Fed sets the federal funds rate â€” the overnight lending rate between banks. All other rates follow its lead.

discovery.text: Short-term bond yields track the fed funds rate closely. Long-term yields reflect growth and inflation expectations.

twist.text: The Fed also buys and sells bonds directly through quantitative easing. It's the biggest player in the market.

climax.text: Fed Chair speeches move markets more than most economic data. A single word change can shift billions.

punchline.text: The Fed doesn't just influence bond markets. It dominates them.

quiz.question: What rate does the Federal Reserve directly control?
